description.narrative: By 2021, greater numbers of people, including duty bearers and influencers, are committed to take action for children through integrated campaigns, media partnership, youth and adolescent engagement, and a 'glocal' approach to influence public policy and win greater support for the cause of children.

title.narrative: Zambia United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Zambia: Outcome evaluation of the investment in institutional community and individual capacity development
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, greater numbers of people, including duty bearers and influencers, are committed to take action for children through integrated campaigns, media partnership, youth and adolescent engagement, and a 'glocal' approach to influence public policy and win greater support for the cause of children.

description.narrative: UNICEF Zambia developed and implemented a 2019 public and policy advocacy plan that supported galvanising action for the cause of children in Zambia. Sustained engagement was conducted with highest political levels including ministers, ambassadors and First Lady. To mark the 30th Anniversary of the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC), Zambia convened the first ever National Children's summit that brought together children-delegates from all 10 provinces who discussed and made resolutions on issues they wanted action on. UNICEF also convened high-level discussions on violence against children, domestic financing for children and child participation. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of initiatives that engage civil society partners and/or coalitions to advocate together with UNICEF for children
Number of Public advocacy events for the three office integrated platforms
Number of high-profile individuals (including GWAs, influencers, political/community/religious leaders, etc.) who publicly support/amplify UNICEF advocacy messages and initiatives
Number of adolescents and young people (10-24 years) participating in activities that enhance their voice
